conclusion: The process from state C to state D is shown as a horizontal line in the p-V diagram at a constant pressure p_CD = 0.75 x 10^5 Pa.
The volume of state C is V_C = 4 L and the volume of state D is V_D = 3 L.
Convert the volumes from liters to cubic meters: V_C = 4 L = 4 x 10^-3 m^3 and V_D = 3 L = 3 x 10^-3 m^3.
The work done by the gas during an isobaric process is given by the formula W = p Î”V = p (V_final - V_initial).
The work done by the gas from C to D is W_CD = p_CD (V_D - V_C).
The work done by the gas from C to D is -75 J, meaning 75 J of work is done on the gas by the surroundings.
The question asks for how much work is done externally by the gas, which usually refers to the work done by the gas on its surroundings.
Assuming the question asks for the magnitude of the work done, take the absolute value.
Magnitude of the work done by the gas from C to D is |W_CD| = |-75 J| = 75 J.
